#Text=No. 6,541,509, the entire disclosure of which is hereby incorporated by reference into this specification, discloses a method for treating neoplasis using combination chemotherapy." claim 1 of this patent describes: "A method of treating neoplasia in a subject in need of treatment, comprising administering to the subject an amount of paclitaxel effective to treat the neoplasia, in combination with an amount of discodermolide effective to treat the neoplasia, wherein a synergistic antineoplastic effect results."

column1: #Text=At column 6 of this patent, the patentees discuss how to determine synergy between two drugs.
#Text=They state that: One measure of synergy between two drugs is the combination index (CI) method of Chou and Talalay [37], which is based on the median-effect principle.
#Text=This method calculates the degree of synergy, additivity, or antagonism between two drugs at various levels of cytotoxicity.
#Text=Where the CI value is less than 1, there is synergy between the two drugs.
#Text=Where the CI value is 1, there is an additive effect, but no synergistic effect.
#Text=CI values greater than 1 indicate antagonism.
#Text=The smaller the CI value, the greater the synergistic effect.
#Text=Another measurement of synergy is the fractional inhibitory concentration (FIC) [48].
#Text=This fractional value is determined by expressing the IC50 of a drug acting in combination, as a function of the IC50 of the drug acting alone.
#Text=For two interacting drugs, the sum of the FIC value for each drug represents the measure of synergistic interaction.
#Text=Where the FIC is less than 1, there is synergy between the two drugs.
#Text=An FIC value of 1 indicates an additive effect.
#Text=The smaller the FIC value, the greater the synergistic interaction.

#Text=In the method of the present invention, combination therapy using paclitaxel and discodermolide preferably results in an antineoplastic effect that is greater than additive, as determined by any of the measures of synergy known in the art."

#Text=As one embodiment of the instant invention, applicants claims: A synergistic combination of antineoplastic agents, comprising an effective antimenoplastic amount of paclitaxel and an effective antineoplastic amount of the preferred, magnetic anti-mitotic compound of this inventon.
#Text=Thus, the process of such U.S.
#Text=Pat.
